content.description:
Tum foribusforis, -is, f. = ianua, -ae divae, media testudinetestudo, -inis, f.: vaulted roof templi, 
saeptasaepio, -ire, saepsi, saeptum: to surround armis, soliosolium, -i, n. = sedes, -isque alte subnixasubnixus, -a, -um, adj.: resting on reseditresedeo, -ere, -sedi = sedeo, -ere.1 
Iura dabat legesque viris, operumque laborem 
partibus aequabat iustisiustus, -a, -um, adj.: fair, aut sorte trahebat.
 1:The subject of resedit is Dido.↩
content.question: In line 3, the case of viris specifies that the men were the ones

choices.label: whose things were being given out
along with whom things were given

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 1.B: Describe how grammar contributes to the meaning and function of Latin words and phrases in context.
